etymology.description: 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable; dish") + 单(單) (dān, "list") = 菜單(菜单) (càidān, "menu")
etymology.interpretation: The word 菜單(菜单) (càidān) combines 菜(菜) (cài, "vegetable; dish") which refers to food or dishes, and 单(單) (dān, "list") indicating a list or record. Together, it logically refers to a list of dishes, or a menu. This reflects the exact purpose of a menu as it provides a list of dishes available to choose from.

examples.chinese: 请给我看菜单(請給我看菜單)，我想点一道菜(我想點一道菜)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ kàn càidān, wǒ xiǎng diǎn yī dào cài.
examples.english: Please show me the menu, I want to order a dish.

examples.chinese: 这里的菜单很丰富(這裡的菜單很豐富)。
examples.english: The menu here is very diverse.
